text: The 1936–37 season was the 64th season of competitive football in Scotland and the 47th season of the Scottish Football League. == Scottish League Division One == Champions: Rangers Relegated: Dunfermline Athletic, Albion Rovers == Scottish League Division Two == Promoted: Ayr United, Greenock Morton == Scottish Cup == Celtic were winners of the Scottish Cup after a 2–1 final win over Aberdeen. == Other Honours == === National === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner- up |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – North |Vale Ocaba |4 – 2second replay |Keith |- |align=left|Scottish Qualifying Cup – South |Duns |2–1 |Galston |} === County === {| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- !width=160|Competition !width=135|Winner !width=80|Score !width=135|Runner-up |- |align=left|Aberdeenshire Cup |Buckie Thistle |7 – 2 * |Aberdeen University |- |align=left|Dumbartonshire Cup |Dumbarton |2–0 |Vale Ocaba |- |align=left|East of Scotland Shield |Hearts |6–2 |Hibernian |- |align=left|Fife Cup |East Fife |1–0 |Dunfermline Athletic |- |align=left|Forfarshire Cup |Arbroath |3 – 1 # |Brechin City |- |align=left|Glasgow Cup |Rangers |6 – 1 # |Partick Thistle |- |align=left|Lanarkshire Cup |Motherwell |6 – 1 * |Airdrie |- |align=left|Perthshire Cup |Breadalbane |4 – 1 * |Blairgowrie |- |align=left|Renfrewshire Cup |Morton |1–0 |St Mirren |- |align=left|Southern Counties Cup |Stranraer |2–1 |St Cuthbert Wanderers |- |align=left|Stirlingshire Cup |Stenhousemuir |6 – 4 * |Alloa Athletic |} * * – aggregate over two legs * # – replay === Highland League === == Junior Cup == Arthurlie were winners of the Junior Cup after a 5–1 win over Kirkintilloch Rob Roy in the final. == Scotland national team == {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents ! !Competition !Scotland scorer(s) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |14 October 1936 |Ibrox Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|2–0 |Friendly |Jimmy Delaney (2) |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |31 October 1936 |Windsor Park, Belfast (A) | |align=center|3–1 |BHC |Charles Napier, Alex Munro, David McCulloch |-bgcolor=#ffdddd |2 December 1936 |Dens Park, Dundee (H) | |align=center|1–2 |BHC |Tommy Walker |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |17 April 1937 |Hampden Park, Glasgow (H) | |align=center|3–1 |BHC |Bob McPhail (2), Frank O'Donnell |-bgcolor=#ffffdd |9 May 1937 |Prater Stadium, Vienna (A) | |align=center|1–1 |Friendly |Frank O'Donnell |-bgcolor=#ddffdd |22 May 1937 |Stadion Sparta-Letna, Prague (A) | |align=center|3–1 |Friendly |James Simpson, Bob McPhail, Torry Gillick |} Key: * (H) = Home match * (A) = Away match * BHC = British Home Championship == Notes and references == == External links == * Scottish Football Historical Archive Category:Seasons in Scottish football
title: 1936–37 in Scottish football
